column4: im not sure about that, do i check the same way i did for the flash?
nope, fresh install
mv ~/ (is there a space here) .mozilla?
so i type it just like this then       mv ~/.mozilla ~/.backup.mozilla
or if you want to use nautilus (file manager): First CTRL+H (to show hidden files and folders), then find .mozilla - then right click on it and choose rename - and rename it.
have you searched the web for ubuntu firefox flash ?
should be an easy fix for this though... tried this? http://askubuntu.com/questions/89932/flash-not-working-in-firefox
should be the same approach.
follow the directions on that page. Start with the apt-get purge command. This command will remove all files related to flash
http://askubuntu.com/questions/108989/adobe-flash-not-working-in-firefox
no progress in flash in firefox?
don't think it has... did you get any information on any flash-alike plugins installed when running synaptics?
let's start here: in Firefox - write about:plugins - See if you have flash there (should say something like shockwave)
right. same as I have.
what is the output of: update-alternatives --list mozilla-flashplugin
on one line
